page_content:
Here is the modified document:

LQ(k) = k \* log(|\~ Σ1(k)|) + (T - k) \* log(|\~ Σ2(k)|)
= k \* log(|Q′| \* |ˆΣ1(k)| \* |Q|) + (T - k) \* log(|Q′| \* |ˆΣ2(k)| \* |Q|)
= 2 T \* log(|Q|) + k \* log(|ˆΣ1(k)|) + (T - k) \* log(|ˆΣ2(k)|)

The log-likelihood of no change for the entire sample becomes

LQ0 = T \* log(|(T−1 ∑^t=1 ˜gt,Q ˜g′_t,Q|)) 
= T \* log(|Q′| \* |(T−1 ∑^t=1 ˆgt ˆg′_t)| \* |Q|)
= 2 T \* log(|Q|)
because (T−1 ∑^t=1 ˆgt ˆg′_t = I_r under (3.1). Thus, the likelihood ratio test under this alternative identification condition can be expressed as

LRQ(k) ≡ − k \* log(|\~ Σ1(k)|) − (T - k) \* log(|\~ Σ2(k)|) + LQ0
